params.note: Nuclei were isolated from sequential sections from basal to apical positions in human, chimpanzee, and macaque cerebral tissue (Fig. 4a).
Nuclei were clustered into populations of neurons, astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, microglia, and endothelial cells (Fig. 4a, b, Extended Data Fig. 10).
scATAC-seq was performed on human and chimpanzee cerebral organoids at multiple time points (iPSC to 4-month-old organoids).
snRNA-seq was performed on sliced tissue cubes from adult human, chimpanzee, bonobo, and macaque prefrontal cortex.
Differentially accessible (DA) peaks and differentially expressed genes were identified between species and cell types.
Gene ontology enrichment analysis was performed on DA peaks in NPCs and neurons (Fig. 4f, g).
t-SNE visualization was used to project single-cell chromatin accessibility and gene expression data (Fig. 4c).
Laminar expression patterns of markers were predicted in adult excitatory neurons and compared across species (Fig. 4e).
Overlap of human-chimpanzee differentially expressed genes was analyzed between adult tissue and organoid trajectories (Fig. 4g).
Genomic conservation (phastCon scores) of cell class markers was assessed across species (Fig. 4c).
